summary: Completed comprehensive testing of ProFireManager application - JWT authentication system, role-based permissions, red UI design, and backend APIs. Found one critical backend issue with planning API.

critical_bugs.issue: Returns 500 Internal Server Error for superviseur, employe, and partiel roles due to MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue
critical_bugs.impact: Planning functionality completely broken for non-admin users
critical_bugs.error_details: ValueError: [TypeError("'ObjectId' object is not iterable"), TypeError('vars() argument must have __dict__ attribute')]

passed_tests: JWT authentication system with 4 demo accounts working
Role-based navigation and permissions working correctly
Red fire department design theme implemented perfectly
Dashboard statistics loading and displaying correctly
Personnel management page working with complete user information
Statistics API working for all roles (8 personnel, 0 gardes, 3 formations, 94% coverage)
User management API with proper role restrictions
Types garde API working for all roles
Remplacements API working for all roles
ProFireManager branding and fire truck emoji display
action_item_for_E1: Fix MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue in planning API endpoint. The error occurs when trying to serialize MongoDB ObjectId objects to JSON. Need to convert ObjectId to string before returning response or use proper serialization method.
should_call_test_agent_after_fix: true - Planning API is a core functionality that needs to be working for all user roles. Once fixed, should verify the planning functionality works correctly for all roles.
